intro: Anthurium soukupii, commonly known as the velvet leaf anthurium, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a velvety texture. The plant produces striking spadices, which are modified leaves that enclose the actual flowers. Anthurium soukupii thrives in humid, warm environments with indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
